docs.lead_paragraph: CANTER--Sid, beloved husband of Jane, father of Barry and Michael, father-in-law of Juan Tamargo and father of the late Steven; beloved brother of Robert of California and the late Alvin and Howard. Services at Congregation B'nai Jacob, Jersey City, Wednesday, February 5th at 1pm. For information 866-473-3700.

docs.snippet: DEAN--Edwin, passed on January 9, 2014 in Boulder, CO. Born December 27, 1936 in Nashville, TN. He is survived by his wife, Kathy Wood Dean and their three sons: Warner, Joel, and Riley. A celebration of his life will be held February 10, 2014 at ...
docs.lead_paragraph: DEAN--Edwin, passed on January 9, 2014 in Boulder, CO. Born December 27, 1936 in Nashville, TN. He is survived by his wife, Kathy Wood Dean and their three sons: Warner, Joel, and Riley. A celebration of his life will be held February 10, 2014 at 5pm at the Church of Heavenly Rest in New York City. In lieu of flowers, donations can be sent to the Edwin and Percy Warner Parks Foundation, 50 Vaughn Road, Nashville, TN. He will be missed by all who knew him. The Clairmont and Gibbons families

docs.lead_paragraph: BRENNER--Suzette. Age 88, on January 31st, formerly of New York City. Beloved wife of the late Frederick; cherished mother of Jayne Gottlieb (Ed) and Linda Betheil (Leslie); adored grandmother (''Gammy'') of Lauren and Melissa; sister of Jules Eisenberg and the late Rita Graham. Service Tuesday 11am at Mt. Hebron Cemetery, Flushing, NY.

docs.snippet: DUBOFSKY--Robert. P and F Industries and its employees extend our deepest condolences on the passing of our friend and esteemed Board member of over 23 years. Our heartfelt sympathy goes to his wife Betsy and his children Ned and Nancy and their e...
docs.lead_paragraph: DUBOFSKY--Robert. P and F Industries and its employees extend our deepest condolences on the passing of our friend and esteemed Board member of over 23 years. Our heartfelt sympathy goes to his wife Betsy and his children Ned and Nancy and their extended families.

docs.snippet: DUBOFSKY--Robert. Our deepest condolences go to our cherished family friend for over 35 years. Bob was a true gentleman in every sense of the word and was loved, cherished and respected by us all. Our broken hearts go out to Betsy, Ned, Nancy and ...
docs.lead_paragraph: DUBOFSKY--Robert. Our deepest condolences go to our cherished family friend for over 35 years. Bob was a true gentleman in every sense of the word and was loved, cherished and respected by us all. Our broken hearts go out to Betsy, Ned, Nancy and their families on this tragic loss. May he rest in peace. Heidi and Richard Horowitz Jill and Jeff Libshutz

docs.snippet: HEYMAN--Anne. Profound and heartfelt condolence wishes to the entire HeymanMerrin family. It was a privilege to have served on the Board of DOROT under Anne's Presidency. She brought intelligence, enthusiasm, and vision to DOROT's activities. Her ...
docs.lead_paragraph: HEYMAN--Anne. Profound and heartfelt condolence wishes to the entire HeymanMerrin family. It was a privilege to have served on the Board of DOROT under Anne's Presidency. She brought intelligence, enthusiasm, and vision to DOROT's activities. Her zest for life was contagious, and her love for her family was unparalleled. Fiona Scharf

docs.snippet: BURKE--Edmund "Ned", 47 of Fairfield, CT, beloved husband of Michele (Carpentier) Burke passed away Thursday, January 30, 2014, after an eight year battle with brain cancer. Ned was born November 23, 1966 in Hartford and raised in Wethersfield, th...
docs.lead_paragraph: BURKE--Edmund "Ned", 47 of Fairfield, CT, beloved husband of Michele (Carpentier) Burke passed away Thursday, January 30, 2014, after an eight year battle with brain cancer. Ned was born November 23, 1966 in Hartford and raised in Wethersfield, the son of Edmund and Gertrude (Carroll) Burke of Pocasset, MA. He graduated from Xavier High School in 1985, Fairfield University in 1989 and received his MBA from Fordham in 1999. Ned had a fifteen year career in Corporate Communications/ Investor Relations with AIG in New York City. Ned had a love of sports, especially golf and the Boston Red Sox and found great joy in bringing friends together. He will always be remembered for his devotion to his wife and children. Besides his wife and parents, Ned is survived by his children, Michael and Mia Burke of Fairfield and a brother, Jonathan Burke of Avon, CT. A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated Saturday, February 8 at 10am directly at the Church of the Incarnation, 544 Prospect Street, Wethersfield, CT. Burial will be private. Calling hours are Friday, February 7, from 3-7pm at the D'Esopo Funeral Chapel, 277 Folly Brook Blvd., Wethersfield, CT. Donations in Ned's memory may be made to The Jimmy Fund, C/O Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, P.O. Box 849168, Boston, MA 02284-9168 or to Xavier High School, Attn: Advancement Office, 181 Randolph Rd., Middletown, CT 06457. For on-line expressions of sympathy please visit www.desopo.com.

docs.snippet: EGOL--Marilyn, June 3, 1941 - January 13, 2014. Daughter to the late Beatrice and Norman Egol, twin sister of the late Morton Egol, sister-in-law to Nancy Egol, sister of David Egol. Marilyn was a loving daughter, sister and aunt to her nieces and...
docs.lead_paragraph: EGOL--Marilyn, June 3, 1941 - January 13, 2014. Daughter to the late Beatrice and Norman Egol, twin sister of the late Morton Egol, sister-in-law to Nancy Egol, sister of David Egol. Marilyn was a loving daughter, sister and aunt to her nieces and nephews. Marilyn's passion was the ballet and her career in public relations in the ballet and other performing arts spanned decades. She was known to family, friends and colleagues for her charming wit and her cultured intellect. Marilyn will be greatly missed.
